name: biomni-find-restriction-sites
title: Biomni: Find Restriction Sites
description: Identify restriction enzyme recognition sites in DNA sequences
content:
Overview

This tool identifies the positions of specific restriction enzyme recognition sites in DNA sequences. Unlike the general enzyme finder, this tool focuses on user-specified enzymes and reports the exact positions and sequences of their recognition sites. It's useful when you already know which enzymes you want to use and need precise location information.

Input Parameters

  • dna_sequence: DNA sequence to analyze (string)
  • enzymes: One or more specific restriction enzyme names to search for (e.g., EcoRI, BamHI)
  • --linear: Optional flag indicating sequence is linear (default: circular)

Input Format

Command-line arguments format:

python find_restriction_sites.py "ATGCGAATTCGAT..." EcoRI BamHI HindIII --linear -o output/

Provide the DNA sequence followed by the specific enzyme names to search for.

Biological Use Case

Precise mapping of restriction sites for cloning design:

  • Map exact positions of restriction sites for cloning strategy planning
  • Verify presence/absence of specific sites in synthetic constructs
  • Identify sites near genes of interest for subcloning
  • Check for unwanted sites that might interfere with cloning
  • Plan positioning of inserts relative to enzyme sites
  • Validate sequence data by confirming expected restriction sites

Output

Returns a JSON file (restriction_sites.json) with detailed information about each enzyme's recognition sites including positions, recognition sequences, and cut site locations.

Category

molecular_biology
